title: 66 Facts You’d Never Guess About Taylor Swift

steps.title: Taylor Swift was born on December 13, 1989.
steps.content: Taylor Swift was born on December 13, 1989. Taylor Alison Swift was born to Scott and Andrea Swift on December 13, 1989, in West Reading, Pennsylvania. [1] X Research source She was the couple’s first child, and her zodiac sign is Sagittarius.

steps.title: She was named after James Taylor.
steps.content: She was named after James Taylor. Swift was named after singer-songwriter James Taylor because he was one of her parents’ favorite artists. Swift’s mother, Andrea, also stated that she chose the name Taylor because it was gender-neutral, and she didn’t want her daughter to face gender discrimination based on her name. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift can play multiple instruments.
steps.content: Taylor Swift can play multiple instruments. Swift is a multi-talented musician. In addition to singing, she also plays several instruments, including 6- and 12-string guitar, piano, banjo, and ukulele. She is most known for playing steel-string acoustic guitars, as these are popular in country, pop, and folk music. [3] X Research source Swift learned to play the 12-string guitar to spite her guitar teacher, who claimed her 12-year-old hands would be too small to play it.

steps.title: Her favorite number is 13.
steps.content: Her favorite number is 13. Swift considers 13 to be her lucky number for several reasons. It’s the day she was born, she turned 13 on Friday the 13th, and her first album went gold in 13 weeks. Early in her career, she also stated that she often won awards when she was seated in the 13th seat, row, or section. When she was younger, she used to draw a 13 on her hand in Sharpie before concerts. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Shania Twain is one of her biggest musical influences.
steps.content: Shania Twain is one of her biggest musical influences. Taylor Swift has cited many musical influences over the years, including The Chicks, Paul McCartney, Faith Hill, and Tim McGraw. One of her biggest early influences, however, was country legend Shania Twain. Swift expressed her admiration for Twain at the 2010 CMA Fest and recounted her first time meeting Twain in a 2008 blog post. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift’s fans are called Swifties.
steps.content: Taylor Swift’s fans are called Swifties. Taylor Swift has a huge fan base all over the world. Her fans have been calling themselves “Swifties” since at least 2010, and Swift has been aware of the term since 2012, calling the trend “adorable.” In 2017, she filed a trademark for the term. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift is 5’10”.
steps.content: Taylor Swift is 5’10”. Taylor Swift stands at 5’10” (or 5’11” according to some sources) tall, towering over many other female celebrities. This doesn’t bother Swift, however, who loves to rock heels. In an interview with Girls’ Life in 2008, she said, “I didn’t like being tall when I would walk up to a group of girls and they were all a head shorter than me. When I can put on a pair of four-inch heels and walk into a room and be taller than everybody else, now I look at it as a good thing.” [7] X Research source

steps.title: Swift is worth 1.6 billion dollars.
steps.content: Swift is worth 1.6 billion dollars. As of 2025, Taylor Swift has a net worth of 1.6 billion dollars, making her the richest female musician in the world. Swift became a billionaire in October 2023 when she was worth an estimated 1.1 billion. She is the first musician to reach billionaire status solely based on the value of her songs and performances. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift grew up on a Christmas tree farm.
steps.content: Taylor Swift grew up on a Christmas tree farm. Taylor Swift was raised on a Christmas tree farm called Pine Ridge Farm near Reading, Pennsylvania. Swift lived there until she was nine years old, when her family moved to Wyomissing, Pennsylvania. She went on to write a song called “Christmas Tree Farm” about her childhood home. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Her first CD was LeAnn Rimes.
steps.content: Her first CD was LeAnn Rimes. Taylor Swift purchased her first CD at six years old. Swift once said that Rimes’s 1996 cover of Bill Mack’s “Blue” sparked her love for country music. She saw Rimes perform for the first time when she was 8 years old. [10] X Research source

steps.title: She performed at a Philadelphia 76ers game at age 11.
steps.content: She performed at a Philadelphia 76ers game at age 11. When Swift was 11 years old, the Philadelphia 76ers basketball team had an opening to perform “The Star-Spangled Banner” at one of their games. Swift sang in front of roughly 20,000 fans at the First Union Center. In an interview with The Reading Eagle , young Swift said that it was an “adrenaline rush.” [11] X Research source

steps.title: At 12, a computer repairman taught her to play guitar.
steps.content: At 12, a computer repairman taught her to play guitar. While Taylor Swift began taking vocal lessons at age 9, she didn’t begin learning to play guitar until age 12. Ronnie Cremer, a guitarist and computer repairman, taught her to play. Cremer was hired to fix Swift’s computer and noticed a guitar in the corner. When he asked if she played, she said no, and he offered to teach her a few chords. He also helped her write her first song, “Lucky You.” [12] X Research source Check out our Taylor Swift Song Are You? quiz!

steps.title: She moved to Nashville at age 14 to pursue a music career.
steps.content: She moved to Nashville at age 14 to pursue a music career. As Taylor Swift became more serious about pursuing a country music career, her parents moved the family to Hendersonville, Tennessee, a suburb of Nashville. Swift went on to perform at many venues around the city, including the Blue Bird Cafe, where she landed her first record deal with Big Machine Records. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Swift’s mother’s name is Andrea.
steps.content: Swift’s mother’s name is Andrea. Andrea Gardner Swift (née Finlay) is Taylor Swift’s mother. When Taylor Swift was born, Andrea worked as a mutual fund marketing executive. Andrea originally wanted Taylor to work in the business world but has always been supportive of her daughter’s music career. Taylor and her mother are very close, and she has written two songs about Andrea. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Swift’s father’s name is Scott.
steps.content: Swift’s father’s name is Scott. Taylor Swift’s father is Scott Kingsley Swift. He worked as a stockbroker and established a financial advisory group called the Swift Group for Merrill Lynch. Scott is very involved in his daughter’s career, and he and Andrea attended many of Taylor’s record-breaking Eras Tour dates. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift has a younger brother named Austin.
steps.content: Taylor Swift has a younger brother named Austin. Taylor Swift’s little brother, Austin Kingsley Swift, was born on March 11, 1992. He is a producer, a businessman, and a former actor, having appeared in the films Live by Night and I.T. He has produced several of Swift’s music videos and manages elements of her music licensing for multimedia uses. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift’s grandmother, Marjorie, was an opera singer.
steps.content: Taylor Swift’s grandmother, Marjorie, was an opera singer. Taylor Swift’s maternal grandmother was Marjorie Finlay, an opera singer and television personality. Swift’s passion for music was inspired by her grandmother, who passed away in 2003. Swift went on to release “Marjorie,” a tribute song to her grandmother, on her album evermore . Swift credits her grandmother with backing vocals which were sampled on the track. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Swift’s parents are divorced.
steps.content: Swift’s parents are divorced. Scott and Andrea Swift divorced in 2011, after rumors of being separated for quite some time. Some sources claim that the relationship became strained because Andrea spent so much time on the road with Taylor, but nothing has been confirmed. Swift allegedly wrote several songs about her parents’ relationship, including “Mine” and “Sad Beautiful Tragic.” Today, Scott and Andrea seem to be on good terms and fully support their daughter’s career. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Swift’s mom once rescued boaters on a jet ski.
steps.content: Swift’s mom once rescued boaters on a jet ski. In 2002, Andrea Swift saved several boaters who were stranded on a sandbar near Stone Harbor, New Jersey. Andrea was out with Taylor and one of Taylor’s friends on a jet ski when she noticed the boat and discovered the state police were unable to reach it. She took the stranded boaters to a nearby police boat. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Her debut album spent 24 weeks at #1 on the Top Country Albums chart.
steps.content: Her debut album spent 24 weeks at #1 on the Top Country Albums chart. Taylor Swift’s debut self-titled album was released on October 24, 2006. In the United States, it spent 24 weeks at the top of the Top Country Albums chart, became the longest-charting album of the 2000s decade on the Billboard 200, and made Swift the first female country artist to write or co-write every song on a certified-platinum album. [20] X Research source Check out our fun Taylor Swift Album Are You? quiz!

steps.title: Many songs on Fearless are rumored to be about Joe Jonas.
steps.content: Many songs on Fearless are rumored to be about Joe Jonas. Swift’s second album Fearless was released on November 11, 2008, becoming the most-awarded country album of all time. Around this time, Taylor Swift had also been broken up with by Jonas Brothers’ member Joe Jonas, and many of the songs were rumored to be about him, including “Forever and Always.” [21] X Research source

steps.title: Speak Now was the first album Swift wrote entirely on her own.
steps.content: Speak Now was the first album Swift wrote entirely on her own. Swift’s third studio album, Speak Now was released on October 25, 2010. She wrote the album entirely by herself while touring in 2009-2010 to reflect on her transition from adolescence to adulthood. The album debuted at #1 on the Billboard 200 chart, selling 1,047,000 copies in its debut week. [22] X Research source

steps.title: In its debut week, Red sold approximately two albums every second.
steps.content: In its debut week, Red sold approximately two albums every second. Taylor Swift’s fourth studio album Red was released on October 22, 2012. According to Billboard , the album sold approximately two copies per second during its debut week, and it accounted for 19.3% of all albums sold in the US during that week. It debuted at #1 on both the Billboard 200 and Country Albums charts. [23] X Research source

1989 was Swift’s first official pop album. While Red had some pop influences, Taylor Swift officially made the jump from country to pop with the release of her fifth album 1989 on October 27, 2014. [24] X Research source The album spent 11 weeks at the top of the Billboard 200 and was certified nine-times platinum. Prior to its release, Swift invited several fans to join her for the “1989 Secret Sessions,” in which they got to hear the album early.

steps.title: Swift wrote reputation after facing intense public scrutiny.
steps.content: Swift wrote reputation after facing intense public scrutiny. Taylor Swift released her sixth album on November 10, 2017. She conceived the album amidst intense media scrutiny over her personal life. The album marked the end of Swift’s “America’s Sweetheart” image, featuring suggestive lyrics and cursing. It became the best-selling album of 2017 in the United States and made Swift the first artist to have four albums each sell more than a million copies within a week. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Her album Lover was originally titled Daylight.
steps.content: Her album Lover was originally titled Daylight . Taylor Swift’s seventh album Lover was released on August 23, 2019. Swift revealed she initially wanted to call the album Daylight but scrapped the idea because she thought it was too “on-the-nose.” The title Lover felt like it better represented the overall theme. [26] X Research source

steps.title: In 2020, Swift dropped two surprise albums, folklore and evermore.
steps.content: In 2020, Swift dropped two surprise albums, folklore and evermore . During the COVID-19 lockdown of 2020, Taylor Swift was hard at work writing songs about the experience. She surprise dropped folklore on July 24, 2020, and its sister album evermore on December 11. [27] X Research source Folklore won Album of the Year at the 63rd Grammy Awards.

steps.title: Her album Midnights broke Spotify’s record for most single-day streams.
steps.content: Her album Midnights broke Spotify’s record for most single-day streams. Swift released her 10th album Midnights on October 21, 2022, as a concept album inspired by sleepless nights throughout her life. At the 66th Grammy Awards, Midnights won album of the year, making Swift the first artist to win the award four times. It also broke the record for the most Spotify streams in a single day. [28] X Research source

steps.title: The announcement of The Tortured Poets Department shocked fans.
steps.content: The announcement of The Tortured Poets Department shocked fans. Taylor Swift announced her 11th album The Tortured Poets Department at the 2024 Grammys. Leading up to the event, Swift had been hinting at the announcement of Reputation (Taylor’s Version) , but this was a red herring. TTPD was released on April 19, 2024, becoming the first album to gain one billion streams in a single week. [29] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift is rerecording her first 6 albums.
steps.content: Taylor Swift is rerecording her first 6 albums. Because her former record label sold her masters without offering her a chance to buy them, Taylor Swift is in the process of rerecording and rereleasing her first 6 albums so she can own the rights to them. These albums are called “Taylor’s Version,” and each feature never-before-released tracks “from the vault.” As of March 2025, Swift has yet to release Reputation (Taylor’s Version) and Taylor Swift (Taylor’s Version) . [30] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift wrote “Our Song” for a high school talent show.
steps.content: Taylor Swift wrote “Our Song” for a high school talent show. “Our Song” would become one of Taylor Swift’s biggest hits from her debut album, but it started out as a high school talent show performance. Swift wrote the song because she wanted to capture the feeling of being in a new relationship and took inspiration from a relationship she had during her freshman year. [31] X Research source

steps.title: Swift and Liz Rose wrote “Tim McGraw” in 15 minutes.
steps.content: Swift and Liz Rose wrote “Tim McGraw” in 15 minutes. In her early songwriting days, Taylor Swift often teamed up with songwriter Liz Rose. After getting the idea for “Tim McGraw” in class, Swift went downtown with Rose, and the two wrote the song in about 15 minutes on the piano. [32] X Research source

steps.title: “Death by a Thousand Cuts” was inspired by the movie Someone Great.
steps.content: “Death by a Thousand Cuts” was inspired by the movie Someone Great . Swift’s song “Death by a Thousand Cuts” was influenced by the relationships of both her friends and fictional characters. She drew a lot of inspiration from the romantic comedy Someone Great . The song’s lyrics are based on character dynamics from the film, as the protagonist attempts to move past a failed relationship. [33] X Research source

steps.title: Swift wrote “The Last Great American Dynasty” about her summer house.
steps.content: Swift wrote “The Last Great American Dynasty” about her summer house. In 2013, Taylor Swift bought a sprawling mansion in Rhode Island called Holiday House. The mansion once belonged to philanthropist Rebekah Harkness, who would throw extravagant parties at the house. Upon learning the history, Swift wrote “The Last Great American Dynasty” about Harkness and the house. [34] X Research source

steps.title: “Soon You’ll Get Better” is about Swift’s mother.
steps.content: “Soon You’ll Get Better” is about Swift’s mother. Taylor Swift’s mother, Andrea, was first diagnosed with breast cancer in 2015 and again in 2019 while also battling a brain tumor. While Andrea is in remission now, Swift had to face the possibility of losing her mother and wrote the song “Soon You’ll Get Better” to face those feelings. Swift has said that the song was very hard to write and is hard to sing. [35] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift used her heartbeat as an instrument in “Wildest Dreams.”
steps.content: Taylor Swift used her heartbeat as an instrument in “Wildest Dreams.” In the hit single “Wildest Dreams,” Swift recorded her heartbeat and incorporated it into the rhythm of the song. Her heartbeat is even credited in the 1989 booklet that lists all the credits for the song. [36] X Research source

steps.title: In 2010, she became the youngest artist to win Album of the Year at the Grammys.
steps.content: In 2010, she became the youngest artist to win Album of the Year at the Grammys. Taylor Swift first won Album of the Year at the 2010 Grammys. She was 20 years old, making her the youngest winner in history at the time (the record has since been surpassed by Billie Eilish). Swift has since been nominated for the award seven times and has won four times. [37] X Research source

steps.title: In 2011 and 2014, Swift was named Billboard’s Woman of the Year.
steps.content: In 2011 and 2014, Swift was named Billboard’s Woman of the Year. Taylor Swift was named Billboard’s Woman of the Year due to her chart-topping success, genre-blending, and her impact beyond music. She was the first and only person to win the award twice. [38] X Research source

steps.title: Michelle Obama presented her with the Big Help Award in 2012.
steps.content: Michelle Obama presented her with the Big Help Award in 2012. At the 25th Annual Nickelodeon Kids’ Choice Awards, Taylor Swift was awarded the Big Help Award by First Lady Michelle Obama. The award recognizes people who have inspired children to be charitable. Swift won the award due to her work to help flood and tornado victims in the South. [39] X Research source

steps.title: She hit #1 on iTunes in Canada for 8 seconds of white noise.
steps.content: She hit #1 on iTunes in Canada for 8 seconds of white noise. One of Taylor Swift’s most surprising (and unintentional) achievements occurred in 2014, when 8 seconds of white noise was listed as “Track 3” of her upcoming album 1989 due to an iTunes glitch. Fans immediately flocked to the “track,” causing it to go #1 on Canadian iTunes. [40] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift has won 14 Grammys.
steps.content: Taylor Swift has won 14 Grammys. As of 2015, Taylor Swift has won a total of 14 Grammy awards with 58 nominations. In addition to 4 Album of the Year victories, Swift has also won Best Female Country Vocal Performance, Best Country Song, Best Country Album, Best Country Solo Performance, Best Song Written for Visual Media, Best Music Video, and Best Pop Vocal Album. [41] X Research source

steps.title: Swift has broken 118 Guinness World Records.
steps.content: Swift has broken 118 Guinness World Records. As of December 2023, Taylor Swift has acquired 118 Guinness World Records. Most recently, she has broken several records for highest-grossing music tours with the highly successful Eras Tour, as well as many “most streamed album” awards. She first broke a Guinness World Record in 2008, with “Most Entries in the US Top 20 in a Year by a Solo Artist.” [42] X Research source

steps.title: The Eras Tour is the highest-grossing tour of all time.
steps.content: The Eras Tour is the highest-grossing tour of all time. By the end of its almost two-year run, Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour grossed an estimated 2.2 billion dollars, making it the highest-grossing tour of all time. In North America alone, the tour grossed over 1.04 billion dollars. The Eras Tour’s total estimated gross nearly doubles that of the second-highest-grossing tour, Coldplay’s “Music of the Spheres,” currently at 1.14 billion. [43] X Research source

steps.title: Swift holds an honorary doctorate from NYU.
steps.content: Swift holds an honorary doctorate from NYU. In 2022, Taylor Swift received an honorary Doctor of Fine Arts degree from New York University because of her significant contributions to the industry. Swift also delivered the commencement address for the graduating class of 2022. [44] X Research source

steps.title: She was named Time’s Person of the Year twice.
steps.content: She was named Time ’s Person of the Year twice. In 2017, Taylor Swift was recognized as one of the Silence Breakers who were honored with the title of Time Magazine ’s Person of the Year for speaking out against sexual misconduct. Then, in 2023, Swift was named Person of the Year by herself for her achievement in the arts. This makes her the first woman to appear twice on a Person of the Year cover. [45] X Research source

steps.title: Swift’s first acting job was on CSI.
steps.content: Swift’s first acting job was on CSI . In 2009, Taylor Swift made her acting debut on an episode of CSI: Crime Scene Investigation . She played the role of Hayley, a girl who was killed, on the 16th episode of season 9, “Turn, Turn, Turn.” Swift was a big fan of the show, and a remix of her song “You’re Not Sorry” was featured in the episode. [46] X Research source

steps.title: She was in the 2010 film Valentine’s Day alongside Taylor Lautner.
steps.content: She was in the 2010 film Valentine’s Day alongside Taylor Lautner. In 2010, Swift played the role of Felicia Miller in the ensemble romantic comedy Valentine’s Day . Her character was dating Willy Harrington, played by Taylor Lautner. The two Taylors went on to date in real life. [47] X Research source

steps.title: Swift voiced Audrey in The Lorax.
steps.content: Swift voiced Audrey in The Lorax . In 2012, Taylor Swift was cast to voice the character Audrey in The Lorax , working alongside Danny DeVito and Zac Efron. This was the first time Swift had voiced an animated character, and she said it required a “completely different” headspace than recording music. [48] X Research source

steps.title: She once made a cameo in New Girl.
steps.content: She once made a cameo in New Girl. In 2013, Taylor Swift made a brief cameo in the season 2 finale of the hit show New Girl , starring Zooey Deschanel. Swift played Elaine, who runs off with the man the character Cece is supposed to marry. Swift was a fan of the show, and Deschanel (and her character Jess) was a fan of Swift’s music. [49] X Research source

steps.title: She played Rosemary in The Giver.
steps.content: She played Rosemary in The Giver . In 2014, Swift played the role of Rosemary in the film adaptation of The Giver . She appears for only a few moments in the film, as the Giver tells the main character, Jonas, about his daughter, Rosemary. Swift only appears in flashbacks and brief scenes. [50] X Research source

steps.title: Swift was in the movie adaptation of Cats.
steps.content: Swift was in the movie adaptation of Cats . In 2019, Taylor Swift played Bombalurina in the film adaptation of the musical Cats . As a self-proclaimed “cat lady,” Swift was very excited about the role. She sings the song “Macavity” in character and also wrote a song called “Beautiful Ghosts” for the film. [51] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift played a small role in Amsterdam.
steps.content: Taylor Swift played a small role in Amsterdam . In the 2022 film Amsterdam , Swift plays a brief but important character named Elizabeth Meekins, the daughter of Bill Meekins, a US Army General turned senator. Meekins dies early in the film after being pushed into traffic by a hitman. Her death is a major catalyst for the events in the rest of the film. [52] X Research source

steps.title: She is a cat person.
steps.content: She is a cat person. Taylor Swift has proudly called herself a cat lady several times over the years. She currently has three cats: Meredith Grey, Olivia Benson, and Benjamin Button. Meredith and Olivia are both Scottish Folds and named after characters on Grey’s Anatomy and Law & Order: SVU , respectively. Benjamin, her newest cat, is a Ragdoll named after The Curious Case of Benjamin Button . [53] X Research source

steps.title: She is currently dating Travis Kelce.
steps.content: She is currently dating Travis Kelce. As of early 2025, Taylor Swift is in a relationship with NFL player Travis Kelce. The two reportedly began talking in 2023 after Kelce attended the Eras Tour and intended to give Swift a friendship bracelet with his phone number. Swift often attends Kelce’s football games, and Kelce attended many of Swift’s Eras Tour dates. [54] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift is known for her homemade Poptarts.
steps.content: Taylor Swift is known for her homemade Poptarts. In her free time, Swift loves to bake. She has been praised for many of her baked goods, including cinnamon rolls and chai sugar cookies. These days, she often bakes homemade Poptarts for her boyfriend Travis Kelce and the Kansas City Chiefs, who rave about how good they are. [55] X Research source

steps.title: Swift is good friends with Selena Gomez and Ed Sheeran.
steps.content: Swift is good friends with Selena Gomez and Ed Sheeran. Taylor Swift has many famous friends, with a number of them appearing in her music videos. She is very close to singers Selena Gomez and Ed Sheeran. Sheeran has been featured on several of Swift’s songs, and Gomez joined Swift on stage to perform during Swift’s 1989 tour. [56] X Research source

steps.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
steps.content: To Kill a Mockingbird is one of her favorite books. Taylor Swift once revealed that the classic novel To Kill a Mockingbird has greatly influenced her songwriting. She is quoted as saying, “You hear storytelling like in Harper Lee’s To Kill a Mockingbird and it just… makes your mind wander. It makes you feel like it makes your world more vast. And you think about more things and greater concepts after you read something like that.” [57] X Research source

steps.title: Swift publicly feuded with Kanye West and Kim Kardashian.
steps.content: Swift publicly feuded with Kanye West and Kim Kardashian. Taylor Swift’s feud with Kanye West dates back to the 2009 VMAs, when West interrupted her award acceptance on stage. The two later tried to rekindle their relationship until West and his then-wife Kim Kardashian faked a phone call with Swift, claiming she gave West permission to insult her in a song. This turned the public against Swift, causing her to hide from the public eye before it was revealed the phone call had been faked. [58] X Research source

steps.title: Taylor Swift’s childhood best friend is named Abigail.
steps.content: Taylor Swift’s childhood best friend is named Abigail. Taylor Swift may surround herself with celebrities these days, but she hasn’t lost touch with her roots. She is still good friends with her high school best friend, Abigail, who inspired the song “Fifteen.” The pals see each other when they can, and Swift was a bridesmaid in Abigail’s wedding. [59] X Research source

steps.title: Swift is a fan of the Eagles NFL team.
steps.content: Swift is a fan of the Eagles NFL team. Taylor Swift may be dating a Kansas City Chiefs player, but she’s a Philadelphia Eagles fan at heart. Before meeting Travis Kelce, Swift was frequently spotted wearing Eagles merch and even included a line about an Eagles t-shirt in her song “Gold Rush.” [60] X Research source

steps.title: Swift wrote a 350-page novel at age 14.
steps.content: Swift wrote a 350-page novel at age 14. According to some sources, Taylor Swift wrote a novel titled A Girl Named Girl at just 14 years old. In an interview with Vogue in 2012, Swift revealed she’d written a book about a mother who’d wanted a son but had a daughter. Swift claimed she wrote the novel because she was bored during a summer she spent in Stone Harbor, New Jersey. [61] X Research source

steps.title: She used to model for Abercrombie & Fitch.
steps.content: She used to model for Abercrombie & Fitch. Before Taylor Swift’s music career took off, she tried her hand at modeling. In 2003, when she was just 14 years old, she appeared in a moody, black-and-white campaign for Abercrombie & Fitch. In the now-iconic photo, Swift holds a guitar in one hand and wipes tears from her eyes with the other, just like her song “Teardrops on My Guitar.” [62] X Research source

steps.title: Her cat is allegedly worth more than Travis Kelce.
steps.content: Her cat is allegedly worth more than Travis Kelce. According to online net worth calculators, Taylor Swift’s cat Olivia Benson is worth more than NFL star Travis Kelce. Olivia is allegedly worth an estimated 97 million dollars, while Kelce is worth 40 million. Olivia has appeared in several of Swift’s music videos as well as some commercials. [63] X Research source

steps.title: She once got in two car accidents in one day.
steps.content: She once got in two car accidents in one day. While doing an interview for a 2012 issue of Rolling Stone , Taylor Swift got in two car accidents in a single day. The singer was driving the journalist around and revealed in an interview with Graham Norton that one accident was her fault and the other wasn’t. She said, “We got sideswiped. I was fully panicking, and when we got sideswiped, I think he screamed out something like, ‘I have a new baby at home!’ And I was like, this is not gonna be a good cover story for me.” [64] X Research source

steps.title: Swift used to have the same manager as Britney Spears.
steps.content: Swift used to have the same manager as Britney Spears. Taylor Swift is a long-time fan of pop icon Britney Spears, and at one point, each of them worked with manager Dan Dymtrow. Dymtrow has been a manager for over 20 years and has also worked with artists like Avril Lavigne, Aerosmith, and Noah Cyrus. [65] X Research source

steps.title: Swift used to babysit for professional wrestler Jeff Jarrett.
steps.content: Swift used to babysit for professional wrestler Jeff Jarrett. In 2024, professional wrestling legend Jeff Jarrett revealed that Taylor Swift babysat his daughters after his wife passed away in 2007. Swift was a family friend, and Jarrett said she was like a big sister to his daughters. “She’s just a sweetheart,” Jarrett said. “I still call her ‘our girl.’” [66] X Research source
